Name of faculty: Science Department: Microbiology
                                                                  Program: PGDMLT Sem-I Type:DSC-1
                                  Subject:Principles of Clinical Bacteriology, Virology & Mycology
                                                              Credit: 4+2 Total learning hours: 60
        Course description: This course has been prepared to instruct basic and medically relevant
   information on the microbes, viruses and fungi.The microbial structure, growth and development,
   methods and role of sterilization in the context of study of microbes are included. It includes
preservation and maintenance of pure cultures. It also covers basic principles of viral and fungal
                  classification, structures, clinical diseases and laboratory diagnostic methods.
                                                                                               NaN
                                                                         Student learning outcome:
              Demonstrate theory and practical skills in microscopy and their handling techniques
                                                                           and staining procedures
                  Understand the basic microbial structure and function and study the comparative
                                                     characteristics of prokaryotes and eukaryotes
                    Know various Culture media and their applications and also understand various
                                                      physical and chemical means of sterilization
           Know microbial techniques for isolation of pure cultures of bacteria and suitable drug
                                                                                    for treatment.
                       Know viruses with their structure, lab. Diagnosis and preventive measures.
             Explain fungi including their morphology and different techniques of lab. Diagnosis.
                                              Discuss various viral and fungal diseases of human.

Name of faculty: Science   Unnamed: 0         Department: Microbiology
                                                                           Program: PGDMLT Sem-I          NaN                      Type: DSC-2
                                                        Subject:Clinical Pathology andImmunology          NaN                              NaN
                                                                                     Credit: 4+2          NaN         Total learning hours: 60
                                               Course description: The Clinical Pathology course          has been prepared to inform anatomy,
   physiology, formation and collection of various clinical samples (urine, stool, semen, sputum          NaN                              NaN
   etc.).Also routine analysis of various clinical samples is included to expand the view of the          NaN                              NaN
      subject. The Principles of Immunology course has been designed to convey basic information          NaN                              NaN
      about immune system development. Also included humoral and cell mediated immunity, antigen          NaN                              NaN
& antibody in detail. Topics included like Ag-Ab reactions will help the students to know latest          NaN                              NaN
                                               diagnostic methods.Also included immunization and autoimmunity             topic to broaden the
                                                                     perspective of the subject.          NaN                              NaN
                                                                       Student learning outcome:          NaN                              NaN
     The training in this subject enables the students to carry out routine clinical laboratory          NaN                              NaN
                                                      investigation (urine, stool, sputum etc.).          NaN                              NaN
      The candidates are made to learn collection of clinical samples and their processing with          NaN                              NaN
                                                          basic technique and recording of data.          NaN                              NaN
            Analyze various serum samples, for estimation of different components which are the          NaN                              NaN
                           cause of the immune disease or are the diagnostic/prognostic markers.          NaN                              NaN
                                            Gain information about pathogenicity and infection.          NaN                              NaN
                       Know about various immunodeficiency disorders like- Hypersensitivity and          NaN                              NaN
                                                                                   autoimmunity.          NaN                              NaN

Name of faculty: Science Department: Microbiology
                                                              Program: PGDMLT Sem-I Type:SEC-1
                                                       Subject:  Histopathology & Parasitology
                                                          Credit: 4+2 Total learning hours: 60
      Course description: The main purpose of the subject is to update the knowledge about the
   habitat, morphology, life cycle of parasite in human body and to impart knowledge about its
diagnosis in laboratory. Histopathology and cytopathology techniques are included to widen the
                                                                          view of the subject.
                                                                     Student learning outcome:
                                    Know about identification of various parasitic pathogens.
      Recognize different parasite using different procedures with special reference to their
            habitat, morphology, life cycle and their isolation, identification for diagnostic
                                                                                      purpose.
                Learn collection of histopathological samples and their processing with basic
                                                              technique and recording of data.

Name of faculty: Science    Department: Chemistry

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             Subject:Food Chemistry                      NaN
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             Credit: 04(T) + 02 (P) Total learning hours: 60
                                                                                                                                                                    Course description:\rThis course presents concise and relevant information on the composition of foods and the reactions\rthey undergo during processing and storage.  The course will deal with the chemistry of the\rprincipal components of foods, their properties and interactions. This will provide basic information\rregarding the food analysis also.                      NaN

Name of Faculty: Science Department: Biotechnology  Unnamed: 0
                                                                    Program: PGDMLT Sem-I Type: DSE-1         NaN
                                                                       Subject: Bioethics & Biosafety         NaN
                                                                  Credit: 04 Total Learning Hours: 60         NaN
   Course Description: This course introduces students to basic concepts of Bioethics & Biosafety. It         NaN
will also inculcate the importance, need & applications of these areas in the students of any applied         NaN
                     science branch. It will provide information about rules, regulations, laws, acts & protocols
                       regarding bioethics & biosafety to be followed in different fields of science.         NaN
                                                                                                  NaN         NaN
                                                                            Student Learning Outcome:         NaN
                                                    After completion of the course, students will be:         NaN
                         1)Student will be able to appreciate the importance of Bioethics & Biosafety         NaN
       2)Student will be able to implement necessary bioethics rules & regulations wherever needed in         NaN
                                                                                             practice         NaN
       3) Student will be able to identify the need of safety & will to execute it in practical life.         NaN
